verses.roman:
maṇi-pīṭhe ṭhekāṭheki, uṭhe jhanjhani
pīṭhera stuti kare mukuṭa--hena anumāni

synonyms: maṇi-pīṭhe—between the gems and the lotus feet or the throne; ṭhekāṭheki—collision; uṭhe—arises; jhanjhani—a jingling sound; pīṭhera—to the lotus feet or the throne; stuti—prayers; kare—offer; mukuṭa—all the helmets; hena—thus; anumāni—we can imagine.
translation: "When the gems on the helmets of all the predominating deities collide before the throne and the Lord's lotus feet, there is a jingling sound, which seems like prayers offered by the helmets at Kṛṣṇa's lotus feet.
